element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text: This algorithm creates a number of new alternative routes based on an original route, linking the same starting and end points.

element.name: ROUTE
element.text: the original route layer. If the layer has many lines, the first line is taken.

element.name: NROUTES
element.text: The number of new routes to create

element.name: METHOD
element.text: The following methods are available: * Constrained brownian motion * Recombination

element.name: SINUOSITY
element.text: Th ratio between the total distance and the euclidian distance for the resulting lines if the constrained brownian motion method is used.

element.name: USESINUOSITY
element.text: If this is selected, the above field will not have any effect and the sinousity of the base route will be applied.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: A line with new routes. The number of lines in the layer will be the number of routes to calculate entered in the corresponding field.
